episodes.title: 80. The “Risk Percentage” Technique
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: There are many position sizing techniques in the trading world, but today I will focus on the "Risk Percentage" technique.

episodes.title: 79. Position Sizing Principles
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: There really is a science behind position trading that, if used properly, can optimize your trading profits and protect you from catastrophic losses.

episodes.title: 78. The Importance of Position Sizing
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Position sizing is extremely important as it one of the primary methods that you can use to maximize your gains and to prevent your trading losses from wiping out your account.

episodes.title: 77. Discipline is the Key
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: As a full-time trend trader, I can tell you that the trading lifestyle is wonderful. As a trader, I can work from anywhere and I get to work when I want. However, the key to being able create this lifestyle is discipline.

episodes.title: 76. Overcome Your Trading Fears (Part 2)
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Change your perspective to conquer irrational fears.

episodes.title: 75. Overcome Your Trading Fears (Part 1)
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: The key to overcoming fear in trading is to develop a trading plan and stick to it.

episodes.title: 74. Are You Afraid to Trade?
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Fear is a destructive emotion that clouds our judgment when trading and its presence is a clear indication that the trader has failed to stick to, and internalize, his trading plan.

episodes.title: 73. Develop a Winning Mindset
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Olympic athletes know the power of controlling their thoughts. Likewise, successful day traders, swing traders, and position traders believe in their abilities. They believe they will succeed and expect success.

episodes.title: 72. Two Vital Keys for Trading Success
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: From my personal experience, I have found that nearly every trader who fails to earn consistent profits in the markets lacks two very important keys for trading success.

episodes.title: 71. Avoid Stock Market Message Boards
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: In this session, I want to provide you with a simple piece of advice, especially if you are just getting started as a trader: Beware of stock market message boards and chat rooms.

episodes.title: 70. It's Time to Invest in Yourself
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Let me teach you the basics of stock trading and provide you with real-time actionable trading ideas each day.

episodes.title: 69. The Four Stages of a Stock Cycle
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: The better you understand where a stock is within this four-stage cycle, the more profitable your trading will become.

episodes.title: 68. The Contraction Stage
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: The contraction stage is easy to spot on a chart as the price appears to be locked in a downtrend setting lower highs and lower lows.

episodes.title: 67. The Distribution Stage
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: The third stage of a stock cycle is known as the distribution stage. This is a period of selling by large institutions and other smart money investors and marks the beginning of the decline of the underlying stock price.

episodes.title: 66. Buying Stocks on Pullbacks
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Don’t make the mistake of chasing a stock if you miss its initial breakout. Instead, look to buy on the pullbacks.

episodes.title: 65. The Expansion Stage
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: The best swing traders spend their time looking for stocks that have just recently moved out of the accumulation stage and into the expansion stage.

episodes.title: 64. The Stock Accumulation Stage
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: In today's session, Jerry Robinson explains the basics of the stock accumulation stage.

episodes.title: 63. Stock Cycle Analysis
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Most stocks move in cycles. In this session, you will learn the four basic stages that compose the average stock cycle.

episodes.title: 62. Design Your Trading Lifestyle
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: In this session, Jerry Robinson explains one of the greatest benefits of trading.

episodes.title: 61. The Proper Trading Mindset
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: In this session, Jerry Robinson explains why smart traders refuse to allow emotional extremes to sideline them on their way to trading success.

episodes.title: 60. Keeping a Trading Journal
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: In this session, Jerry Robinson explains the items that he includes in his daily trading journal.

episodes.title: 59. Start a Trading Journal

episodes.summary: In this session, Jerry Robinson explains the importance of starting a trading journal.

episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: In this session, Jerry Robinson explains how he uses technical analysis to track what the "smart money" is doing at all times.

episodes.summary: In this session, veteran trader Jerry Robinson explains what you should know about the "Wash Sale Rule."

episodes.title: 44. Stop Loss Orders Are Not Perfect

episodes.summary: In this session, veteran stock trader Jerry Robinson shares a very important lesson on the popular "stop loss" order.

episodes.title: 43. Using Stop Loss Orders
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Now that we understand what a stop loss order is, its time to learn how to use them.

episodes.title: 42. Understanding Stop Loss Orders
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: A stop loss order is a specific order type that instructs your broker to automatically sell your stock if it falls to a price as specified by you.

episodes.title: 41. Introducing the Limit Order
episodes.author: Follow the Money Radio
episodes.summary: Limit orders help traders and investors manage their entry price into a stock.

episodes.title: 37. Its All About the Entry Price
